intro: Centaurea gheorghieffii, commonly known as the Gheorghieffii knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Romania. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky habitats.
